main event: An intense light and a white oval object with bright emitted light were observed at Hallett Station, Antarctica on July 7, 1962.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 6 minutes and included one object observed through a telescope., The object moved rapidly along the horizon before disappearing., Other witnesses reported seeing several smaller lights trailing behind the main object., The sighting was documented under clear weather conditions., The intensity of the light was said to be brighter than flares used for nighttime observations.
sighted object: white oval object emitting bright light and trailing smaller lights
witness description: observers at Hallett Station, including the Commanding Officer
